item.title: Nvm
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:1, topic:459661”]What I need to know is the following:

-How do I start a livestream?
-How do others see that a person is currently livestreaming?
-What can they specifically see?
-Is there a way to disable mics?
-How do you END/SAVE a livestream session?
-Finally, how do you post your livestreamed videos?[/quote]

-You would need a broadcaster software most people use Xsplit which can be found here http://www.xsplit.com/. Then you would need to signup from one of these websites justin.tv or http://www.own3d.tv/ most commonly used for channels. Next, you would check your upload speed at speedtest.net because if its low you will have bad lag. After that you would just basically link your channel to the xsplit software.

-Most people will have a link that they will give out so people can go to their channel or the video.

-They basically see anything on your desktop or whatever your doing… or you can set it to a certain part of the screen that they can only see.

-Yes there is an option for that

-You hit stop recording or broadcasting / File, Save as -just remember where you are saving it to.

-With these website/channels after the livestream is over it basically is already on your channel for people to watch.

Even though the title says YouTube this is mostly what YouTubers use to livestream if they aren’t doing it from their youtube channel which I don’t know how to do I just used the Xsplit and got a channel. Hopefully someone more experienced with the YouTube way could possible give information but other then that, that’s how I did livestreams made it much easier too. I hope this helps Good Luck!

Read full topic
